answers.text: Heinrich Friedrich Karl vom und zum Stein and Karl August von Hardenberg

qas.question: What was included in the reform?

answers.text: emancipation of the serfs and Jews

qas.question: In what year was East and West Prussia first united?
When did East and West Prussia split again?

plausible_answers.text: Heinrich Friedrich Karl vom und zum Stein

qas.question: Who was the leader of the Province of Prussia?
Who was the first leader of the Regierungsbezrik of Allenstein?

plausible_answers.text: Heinrich Friedrich Karl vom und zum Stein

qas.question: Who led the East Prussian province in 1878?
Who led the West Prussian province in 1878?
What did the northern districts of East Prussia form in 1905?

context: The succeeding Prussian reforms instigated by <a0_0><b4_0><b6_0>Heinrich Friedrich Karl vom und zum Stein<b6_0/><b4_0/> and <b5_0><b7_0>Karl August von Hardenberg<b7_0/><b5_0/><a0_0/> included the implementation of an Oberlandesgericht appellation court at Königsberg, a municipal corporation, economic freedom as well as <a1_0>emancipation of the serfs and Jews<a1_0/>. In the course of the Prussian restoration by the 1815 Congress of Vienna, the East Prussian territories were re-arranged in the Regierungsbezirke of Gumbinnen and Königsberg. From 1905, the southern districts of East Prussia formed the separate <b8_0>Regierungsbezirk of Allenstein<b8_0/>. East and West Prussia were first united in personal union in <a2_0>1824<a2_0/>, and then merged in a real union in 1829 to form the Province of Prussia. The united province was again split into separate East and West Prussian provinces in <a3_0>1878<a3_0/>.
